11struct facebounds
12{
13 ushort u1, u2, v1, v2;
14
15 bool empty() const { return u1 >= u2 || v1 >= v2; }

101class cube
102{
103 public:
104 cube *children;
105 cubeext *ext;
106 union
107 {
108 uchar edges[12];
110 uint faces[3];
111 };
112 ushort texture[6];
113 ushort material;
114 uchar merged;
115 union
116 {
117 uchar escaped;
118 uchar visible;
119 };
126 bool isempty() const
127 {
128 return faces[0]==faceempty;
129 }
130
134 bool issolid() const
135 {
136 return faces[0]==facesolid &&
137 faces[1]==facesolid &&
138 faces[2]==facesolid; //check all three
139 }

141 void setmat(ushort mat, ushort matmask, ushort filtermat, ushort filtermask, int filtergeom);

175 struct pvert
176 {
177 ushort x, y;
178
179 pvert() {}
180 pvert(ushort x, ushort y) : x(x), y(y) {}
181
182 bool operator==(const pvert &o) const
183 {
184 return x == o.x && y == o.y;
185 }
186 bool operator!=(const pvert &o) const
187 {
188 return x != o.x || y != o.y;
189 }
190 };
191
192 struct pedge
193 {
194 pvert from, to;
195
196 pedge() {}
197 pedge(const pvert &from, const pvert &to) : from(from), to(to) {}
198
199 bool operator==(const pedge &o) const
200 {
201 return from == o.from && to == o.to;
202 }
203 bool operator!=(const pedge &o) const
204 {
205 return from != o.from || to != o.to;
206 }
207 };
208
209 class plink : public pedge
210 {
211 public:
212 int polys[2];
213
214 plink()
215 {
216 clear();
217 }
218
219 plink(const pedge &p) : pedge(p)
220 {
221 clear();
222 }
223 private:
224 void clear()
225 {
226 polys[0] = polys[1] = -1;
227 }
228 };

276struct selinfo
277{
278 int corner;
279 int cx, cxs, cy, cys;
280 ivec o,
281 s;
282 int grid,
283 orient;
284 selinfo() : corner(0), cx(0), cxs(0), cy(0), cys(0), o(0, 0, 0), s(0, 0, 0), grid(8), orient(0) {}
285 int size() const
286 {
287 return s.x*s.y*s.z;
288 }
289
290 int us(int d) const
291 {
292 return s[d]*grid;
293 }
294
302 bool operator==(const selinfo &sel) const
303 {
304 return o==sel.o && s==sel.s && grid==sel.grid && orient==sel.orient;
305 }
306
307 bool validate()
308 {
309 extern int worldsize;
310 if(grid <= 0 || grid >= worldsize)
311 {
312 return false;
313 }
314 if(o.x >= worldsize || o.y >= worldsize || o.z >= worldsize)
315 {
316 return false;
317 }
318 if(o.x < 0)
319 {
320 s.x -= (grid - 1 - o.x)/grid;
321 o.x = 0;
322 }
323 if(o.y < 0)
324 {
325 s.y -= (grid - 1 - o.y)/grid;
326 o.y = 0;
327 }
328 if(o.z < 0)
329 {
330 s.z -= (grid - 1 - o.z)/grid;
331 o.z = 0;
332 }
333 s.x = std::clamp(s.x, 0, (worldsize - o.x)/grid);
334 s.y = std::clamp(s.y, 0, (worldsize - o.y)/grid);
335 s.z = std::clamp(s.z, 0, (worldsize - o.z)/grid);
336 return s.x > 0 && s.y > 0 && s.z > 0;
337 }
338};
339
340struct block3
341{
342 ivec o, s;
343 int grid, orient;
344 block3() {}
345 block3(const selinfo &sel) : o(sel.o), s(sel.s), grid(sel.grid), orient(sel.orient) {}
346
347 cube *c()
348 {
349 return reinterpret_cast<cube *>(this+1);
350 }
351
352 int size() const
353 {
354 return s.x*s.y*s.z;
355 }
356};

364struct undoent

370struct undoblock
371{
372 undoblock *prev, *next;
373 int size,
374 timestamp,
375 numents;
377 block3 *block()
378 {
379 return reinterpret_cast<block3 *>(this + 1);
380 }
381
382 uchar *gridmap()
383 {
384 block3 *ub = block();
385 return reinterpret_cast<uchar *>(ub->c() + ub->size());
386 }
387
388 undoent *ents()
389 {
390 return reinterpret_cast<undoent *>(this + 1);
391 }
392};

399inline void setcubefaces(cube &c, uint face)
400{
401 c.faces[0] = c.faces[1] = c.faces[2] = face;

404#define EDGE_GET(edge, coord) ((coord) ? (edge)>>4 : (edge)&0xF)
405#define EDGE_SET(edge, coord, val) ((edge) = ((coord) ? ((edge)&0xF)|((val)<<4) : ((edge)&0xF0)|(val)))
406
407#define CUBE_EDGE(c, d, x, y) ((c).edges[(((d)<<2)+((y)<<1)+(x))])
408
409inline int octadim(int d)
410{
411 return 1<<d;
412}
413
414//note that these macros actually loop in the opposite order: e.g. loopxy runs a for loop of x inside y
415#define LOOP_XY(b) for(int y = 0; y < (b).s[C[DIMENSION((b).orient)]]; ++y) for(int x = 0; x < (b).s[R[DIMENSION((b).orient)]]; ++x)
416#define LOOP_XYZ(b, r, f) { for(int z = 0; z < (b).s[D[DIMENSION((b).orient)]]; ++z) LOOP_XY((b)) { cube &c = blockcube(x,y,z,b,r); f; } }
417#define LOOP_SEL_XYZ(f) { if(local) makeundo(); LOOP_XYZ(sel, sel.grid, f); rootworld.changed(sel); }
418#define SELECT_CUBE(x, y, z) blockcube(x, y, z, sel, sel.grid)
419
420// guard against subdivision
421#define PROTECT_SEL(f) { undoblock *_u = newundocube(sel); f; if(_u) { pasteundoblock(_u->block(), _u->gridmap()); freeundo(_u); } }
422
423#define DIMENSION(orient) ((orient)>>1)
424#define DIM_COORD(orient) ((orient)&1)
425#define OPPOSITE(orient) ((orient)^1)

542extern cubeworld rootworld;
543
544struct undolist
545{
546 undoblock *first, *last;
547
548 undolist() : first(nullptr), last(nullptr) {}
549
550 bool empty() { return !first; }
551
552 void add(undoblock *u)
553 {
554 u->next = nullptr;
555 u->prev = last;
556 if(!first)
557 {
558 first = last = u;
559 }
560 else
561 {
562 last->next = u;
563 last = u;
564 }
565 }
566
567 undoblock *popfirst()
568 {
569 undoblock *u = first;
570 first = first->next;
571 if(first)
572 {
573 first->prev = nullptr;
574 }
575 else
576 {
577 last = nullptr;
578 }
579 return u;
580 }
581
582 undoblock *poplast()
583 {
584 undoblock *u = last;
585 last = last->prev;
586 if(last)
587 {
588 last->next = nullptr;
589 }
590 else
591 {
592 first = nullptr;
593 }
594 return u;
595 }
596};
